item.title: SampleCode
item.description: A description of my first post.
item.content:encoded:
what's new in Swift 5.9

#Swift #Apple/WWDC/23

Expressive code

If-expressions

let bullet =
    if isRoot && (count == 0 || !willExpand) { "" }
    else if count == 0 { "- " }
    else if maxDepth <= 0 { "▹ " }
    else { "▿ " }

let attributedName = 
				if let displayName, !displayName.isEmpty {
            AttributedString(markdown: displayName)
        } else {
            "Untitled"
        }

Result builders Enhancement in error check

Generics [[Generalize APIs using parameters packs]] Multiple arguments<each Result>

func evaluate<each Result>(_: repeat Request<each Result>) -> (repeat each Result)

Macro system

[[Swift macros]] Macros are apis just like functions, using import keyword, and can be delivered by packages.

[image:A6717A18-0D01-4822-AACD-7A3CC81A076C-24554-000006BDCB96ABCC/DD8508C2-D890-41B8-A325-47311DB642E4.png] Mapping input to output at compile time and using complier plug-in.

Macro’s role

@freestanding and @attached [image:528C6F5F-4AE6-4201-ABC1-97943A756C6F-24554-000006BF3E58C2AA/290DE12C-D59B-4DE5-9BCD-9821D1C0285B.png]

@Observable solve the repeat of @Published, and can automatically add this to every stored property. [image:B3107BEE-23DE-4787-94BA-A17C6F09742F-24554-000006C16F612417/D2B362AB-FED2-45FC-9A4B-BB6FE10D9775.png]

Integrated with Xcode, Swift Macros can be expanded in the editor.

Swift foundation

Faster than Objective-C.

Ownership: ~Copyale to struct or enum.

C++ interoperability

Generate apis automatically.

Abstract concurrency model

???

FoundationDB

Use in a variety of environments, written largely in C++.
